content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Psilocybin including basics, effects, dosage, history, legal status, photos, research, media coverage, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Please donate to support Erowid Center's vision!

Psilocybin & Psilocin



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

None

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Psychedelic Tryptamine

CHEMICAL NAME

Psilocybin: O-phosphoryl-4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine Psilocin: 4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine

DESCRIPTION

Psilocybin and psilocin are naturally occurring psychedelics with a long history of human use. Both are present in 'psychedelic' or 'magic' mushrooms. Psilocybin, the better known of these two chemicals, is metabolized after ingestion into psilocin, which is the primary active chemical.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

TiHKAL Psilocybin Entry

NATURAL SOURCES #

Psilocybin Mushrooms

HISTORY #

Psilocybin Timeline

MEDICAL USE #

Cluster Headache Treatment with Psilocybin Mushrooms & LSD

ARTICLES & WRITINGS #

Practical Data from Psilocybin Research - Erowid Extracts, Nov 2011

Psilocybin and Mystical Experience: 14-Month Follow-Up - Erowid Extracts, Nov 2008


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on psilocybin and psilocin, including their chemical properties, natural sources, effects classification, and relevant research articles. It is part of the larger Erowid webpage dedicated to psychoactive substances, helping users access comprehensive data on psychedelic compounds, their health, legal status, and scientific studies.

                    Context: 
                    This excerpt is from the Psilocybin page on Erowid, highlighting recent media coverage and news articles from 2006 to 2008 that discuss the scientific, cultural, and spiritual research findings on psilocybin and mystical experiences associated with magic mushrooms. It provides a curated list of prominent publications and studies relevant to the examination of psilocybin's effects on consciousness and spirituality. This content enhances understanding of psilocybin's significance in both scientific and cultural contexts within the broader document.
